oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bill Wilkerson Hearing and Speech Center, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1957, Vol. 5 p. 111
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the exterior of the Bill Wilkerson Hearing and Speech Center building, located on 19th Avenue South. The facility was constructed circa 1956, and it was named for the son of the founder, Dr. Welsey Wilkerson. Bill Wilkerson, a soldier in World Wark II, was killed in the the Battle of the Builge at age 19. During the next few decades,m a modern facility was built at Vanderbilt University's Medical Center East and the scope of its program mission expanded. Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1957. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
